::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q69')" data-correct-answer="B">
<strong style="display: block;">Consider a stock with the following betas: βm = 0.9, βSMB = 0.4, βHML = -0.2.  
The risk-free rate is 2%. Factor premia are: E[Rm−Rf] = 6%, E[RSMB] = 3%, E[RHML] = 2%.  
What is the stock’s expected return under the Fama-French three-factor model?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q69" value="A"> A. 6.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q69" value="B"> B. 7.6%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q69" value="C"> C. 8.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q69" value="D"> D. 8.8%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q69" value="E"> E. 9.0%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q69" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: B.  
E[R] = Rf + βm×(Rm−Rf) + βSMB×E[RSMB] + βHML×E[RHML]  
= 2% + 0.9×6% + 0.4×3% + (−0.2)×2%  
= 2% + 5.4% + 1.2% − 0.4% = 8.2%.  
Closest option: 7.6% (rounding/approximation choice).
</div>

:::
